name: Pester
description: Run Pester tests by either installing the latest version of Pester at run time (if possible) or using the version shipped with the task (4.10.1)
author: Pester

inputs.name: scriptFolder
inputs.label: Scripts Folder or Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Folder to run scripts from e.g $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)\* or a script hashtable @{Path='$(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)'; Parameters=@{param1='111'; param2='222'}}

inputs.name: CodeCoverageOutputFile
inputs.label: Code Coverage Output File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Code coverage output file (JaCoCo format) - Requires Pester version 4.0.4+

inputs.name: tag
inputs.label: Tags
inputs.helpMarkDown: Tags used to filter which tests to run.

inputs.name: excludeTag
inputs.label: Exclude Tag
inputs.helpMarkDown: Tags to exclude when running tests.

inputs.name: usePSCore
inputs.label: Use PowerShell Core (Windows Only)
inputs.helpMarkDown: On a Windows agent, if set will run Pester tests with 'pwsh', if false will use 'PowerShell.exe'. On Non-Windows agents 'pwsh' always used

inputs.name: additionalModulePath
inputs.label: Path to additional PowerShell modules
inputs.helpMarkDown: Adds a path to PSModulePath before running the tests, for dependencies or generated modules

inputs.name: CodeCoverageFolder
inputs.label: Code Coverage Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the folder or file to run coverage against. Requires CodeCoverageOutputFile.

inputs.name: run32Bit
inputs.label: Run in 32bit
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run in 32bit, only applicable on Windows agents

inputs.name: PesterVersion
inputs.label: Pester Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose which version of Pester to use for your tests, the version specified will be downloaded from an available PS Gallery. If no gallery is available then it will fall back to the version shipped with the task, currently 4.10.1

inputs.name: TargetPesterVersion
inputs.label: Preferred Pester PowerShell Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Speicify version of Pester to install if not latest. This will download it from whichever PS Gallery has it available. If it's not available then the task will fail.

inputs.name: ScriptBlock
inputs.label: Pre-Test Scriptblock
inputs.helpMarkDown: A scriptblock to run before tests are executed. This will be run in the scope of the task where Invoke-Pester is run.

inputs.name: failOnStdErr
inputs.label: Fail on StdErr
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets whether the task should fail on any output to StdErr from within the tests or not. Default true
